title: TBird 102.11.0 Can't receive emails, but can send. Strange pop-up flags GoDaddy but....
content:
It's odd, and I do hope someone there can help. I have TWO laptops running Win 10, and both using TBird as main email facility, and recently one of them has started showing me this GoDaddy UK branded popup, with the message in what appears to be the URL panel. The other PC continues to send and receive, no problems. I've done an error search... see attached clip. I have my own email address (admin@aulpaech.com) supplied through GoDaddy, which uses Miscrsoft365 as its email operative (or something). I spent (wasted) 90 minutes recently with a GoDaddy rep who tried hard but finally couldn't help and sent me to TBird for additional help, because they don't support this platform. I have done a bit of virus and malware hunting without any success in unblocking this. I am ready to export and uninstall and then reinstall TBird if this is a possible fix.

PLEASE HELP

Alas, I have a low-medium knowledge of the technicals here...

title: Ancora gmail
content:
Buongiorno periodicamente mi collegavo a Gmail mediante client per scaricare lo spazio su disco, tutto andava bene, l'autorizzazione era mediante pw Ora dovevo definitivamente migrare su client tutta la gestione della posta

Ho appreso collegandomi con Thunderbird della modifica all'accesso mediante Oauth2 e non più pw Ho impostato l'OAUTH, ho concesso i cookies come consigliato da qualche parte, non vi sono pw impostate

Il client apre la finestra di connessione a GMAIL, con il mio nome utente, digito la pw, il menù successivo chiede di dare i consensi che do (separatamente mi viene inviata una mail da GMAIL che mi conferma che ho concesso autorizzazioni al client, tutto ok). Ma la connessione va in errore - avviene subito ove client gira in windows 11, l'errore è questo "Autenticazione non riuscita durante la connessione al server imap.gmail." - se uso il cliente su WIN XP SP3, non si arriva ad una risposta ma il client continua a riferire, in basso a sx "invio di dati in corso...." poi dopo molto tempo va in errore Evidentemente il fatto che su due s.o. si verifichi lo stesso problema e dato il fatto che anche le due versioni di TB siano differenti (102.11.0 a 64 bit su windows 11 e 52.9.1 a 32 bit (ultima disponibile, credo, su XP) mi suggerisce che il problema di parametraggio fra TB e GMAIL sia su GMAIL, non sono riuscito a trovare niente altro online nè qui è su Google Di fatto TB è tagliato fuori da GMAIL Grazie in anticipo F
creator: user265662113335218992054474673652814433576

title: mail box
content: my mail box is 85% full how do I TAKE OUT
creator: culican14

title: TB mi dice che non riesce a salvare nella posta inviata
content:
Quando c'è un piccolo allegato alla mia mail, TB ci mette tantissimo nel tentare di salvare il messaggio nella cartella di posta inviata, poi alla fine mi dice che non riesce a salvare nella posta inviata e mi propone: "riprova", "annulla" o "non salvare". Clicco su "non salvare" ma poi vedo che in realtà copia del messaggio inviato è correttamente nella cartella "posta inviata". Perché?

Grazie.
creator: passegua

title: Empty Message body
content: After I updated my Mac system to Monterey 12.6.6 the message body of my emails in Thunderbird are empty. Doesn't TB work in the updated OS?
creator: ppond4

title: Thunderbird is very slow wit my IMAP accounts
content:
My thunderbird speed is near to non useable - latency hickups in the UI that are very stressy even opening emails and sometimes while writing text in the email is pausing once in a while, very bad latency while using the UI, not unuseable but very annoying

System:

Thunderbird: 102.11.0 (64-Bit)

Win10 x64, 1 Year old Computer: 11th-Gen Intel Core i7-11700K/3.6Ghz 8 Cores, 32GB RAM, Only Thunderbird, Chrome and some VStudio Versions installed its a more or less release test system for my C/C++ development - so very clean, up to date and all settings left as default (Equaly slow on a 12 years old PC and a 5 years old i7 Laptop)

Problem:

i've got 5 SMPT/IMAP accounts (for years) and the UI response of Thunderbird is very bad (it degraded over the last major updates but now its getting real problematic) sometimes serveral seconds until the UI shows up, or serveral seconds 10-20 when im deleting 10-50 msg from a mailing list folder etc. thunderbird seems stucking all the while, nearly to a point that doesn't make fun using it (idea) it seems that the slowest server (gmx.net) is raising the latency of the complete UI very much, seems like there is only one thread thats blocking the UI while gathering (slowly) server data

What i tried so far:

-(as usual) i compressed my accounts, cleaned up garbage etc. - so im not having millions of old mails sitting around

-i've tested "The Bat!" and Outlook as eMail clients and they are blasting fast - same accounts/same settings SMPT/IMAP no latency/or UI reaction problems at all

-CPU usage seems to be not super high: 9-10% while blocking

What i did not:

-i did not test the linux version of thunderbird so far

-did not removed the accounts to check if the server speed/latency is relevant

Question:

-is it a known problem that Thunderbird can be super slow?

-are there any Thunderbird tools/command line parameters to give better information whats happening on my system?


Thanks for any help/tips
creator: dl.soluz

title: Can this be avoided? Godaddy is forcing a change to 'EXCHANGE' setting for Microsoft 365 email, and OWL for Exchange is requiring FULL access to my email and all computer files with the ability to read, store, and alter anything.
content:
Godaddy and Microsoft 365 email is forcing users to change settings to EXCHANGE. OWL for Exchange is requiring FULL access to mail and all computer files with the ability to read, store, and alter anything.

Why and how is this possible? Is there no alternative?
creator: davidwesteps

title: Why is Thunderbird connecting this huge list of servers?
content:
Checking the servers and domains that are connected by ThunderBird was a horrifying experience:

incoming-telemetry.thunderbird.net aus.thunderbird.net thunderbird-settings.thunderbird.net live.thunderbird.net services.addons.thunderbird.net versioncheck-bg.addons.thunderbird.net versioncheck.addons.thunderbird.net

location.services.mozilla.com


Are you crazy?!? Totally?


I am using Mozilla products for PRIVACY and SECURITY !

I don't want to be collected for telemetry and location! And also for nothing else that is not ESSENTIAL for using the App!

1) Please explain for which reason any and all of the above servers get connected Esp. what is "aus" for and "live"? What does the "settings" host is used for? Why are there 2 "versioncheck" servers?

2) Please FIX this list by removing any and all statistic-collectors like for telemetry and locations! And also by removing other, non-essential hosts!

Thanks!
creator: onlywebmail.2011

title: Folder names mysteriously appear at top of screen
content: When scrolling past folders, some folder names start appearing at top of screen. These folders are not being opened. v 102.11.0, 64 bit.
creator: njziggy

title: I Do Not Receive CC: Copies
content: I have version 102.11.0 on my Mac Catalina. Recently I noticed problems on this Thunderbird. Last month I sent eFaxes that did not go through. My telephone service is looking into that since they provide the email address I am to use for faxing. However, I sent an email with attachment to my GMAIL address, which is not synced with Thunderbird, so that I could bring the file from that inbox into Google Drive. The attachment is a text document I am working on with Google apps. Though the email arrived, in Thunderbird I did not receive a cc: copy, as I usually make with all my email messages. Strange that this should happen after many months of reliability.
creator: tightpurchaser

title: Thunderbird Not Responding after many attempts to install
content: I have installed Thunderbird countless times on my Samsung Flex Alpha computer, with absolutely NO success ever. It goes through the motions downloading emails, but in the end, everything I click causes white "not responding" screen to appear at top ... I am at a loss. I did go into Windows Firewall and make sure it had an exception on both the "private" and "public" settings. That did not solve anything. It pulls new emails and gives a pop-up notification. However, when I click into the program, it shows an hourglass and says "not responding." Please help me get this to work. I cannot stand other email aggregators, and I think I have tried all the free ones. HELP please and thank you in advance!
creator: ddan1111

title: Message filter turns itself off.
content:
The message filter has been turning off on its own and randomly only at certain email addresses for some time now.

The email address is on our own domain, but other email addresses on the same domain are not experiencing this phenomenon.

Also, if I delete the address and recreate it, or re-set up my email in a completely new environment, the phenomenon recurs.

Any advice on email filters would be greatly appreciated.

＊We apologize that this may be difficult to read due to automatic translation.

title: Thunderbird calendar transfer to new PC
content: I have exported the calendar entries to an ics file. When I try to import them on another PC it fails with an error indicating something about the entries having dismissed an alert and needing to be read only. How do I get around this?

content: I want the emails on the server to delete once I download them on Thunderbird. Is this possible using IMAP with Thunderbird? I don't want emails stored on some remote server. I want to get my emails from Thunderbird after I have received them, and after 10 days remove these read emails from the server while keeping my thunderbird emails on my PC. Please can you help!
